result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter from Defendant to Judge Mayer requesting modification of bond
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:01 PM Defendant Courtney C Rice in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Courtney C Rice.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kerry Kelm appears in person.  Clerk-EAM
20CM388, 21CF389, 21CM6, 21CM53, 21CM308, 21TR1200, 21TR1201, 22CF229, 22CF295
Atty Erdman- 22CF229 set for trial.  No agreement.  Def doesn't want to enter into a plea on this case.  Waiting on discovery.  OWI-4th case was just recently re-filed.  
Court sets 22CF295 for a preliminary hearing on 11/09/2022 at 3:00 pm
Court sets 22CF229 for jury trial on Feb 1, 2023 beginning at 8:30 am with final pre-trial on 01/05/2023 at 3:00 pm, motion in limine, jury instructions and witness lists due by 01/04/2023
All other files including 22CF229 set for status on 11/09/2022
Atty Kelm represents def on CM files.  She will be talking with Atty Erdman.
Atty Erdman-Def wants to be heard on bond.  She is getting married in Oct and disagrees that she is a habitual criminal.  
Atty Kelly-Def has many open cases and many missed court appearances.  Has been bond over for trial.  Bond is appropriate.
Court- Agrees with DA and will not modify bond
End  3:26 pm
